018
019package org.jgrapes.util.events;
020
021import java.util.ArrayList;
022import java.util.Collection;
023import java.util.Collections;
024import java.util.HashMap;
025import java.util.HashSet;
026import java.util.List;
027import java.util.Map;
028import java.util.Optional;
029import java.util.Set;
030import java.util.StringTokenizer;
031import java.util.TreeMap;
032import java.util.regex.Pattern;
033import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
034import org.jgrapes.core.Manager;
035
036/**
037 * An event to indicate that configuration information has been
038 * updated.
039 * 
040 * Configuration information provided by this event is organized
041 * by paths and provided as key/value pairs. The path information
042 * should be used by components to select the information important
043 * to them. Often, a component simply matches the path from the event
044 * with its own path in the component hierarchy 
045 * (see {@link Manager#componentPath()}). But paths can also be used
046 * to structure information in a way that is completely independent of
047 * the implementation's structure as the filtering is completely up
048 * to the component.
049 * 
050 * Configuration information should be kept simple. Sometimes, however,
051 * it is unavoidable to structure the information associated
052 * with a (logical) key. This should be done by reflecting the structure
053 * in the names of the keys. Names "key.0", "key.1", "key.2"
054 * can be used to express that the value associated with "key" is 
055 * actually a list of values. "key.a", "key.b", "key.c" can be used
056 * to associate "key" with a map from "a", "b", "c" to some values.
057 * To support this kind of structuring by keys, the method 
058 * {@link #set(String, Map)} can be used to associate a path with
059 * structured information, consisting of (nested) {@link Map}s and 
060 * {@link Collection}s. The leaf nodes in this structures are used
061 * as values after applying {@link Object#toString()} to them.
062 * Method {@link #structured(String)} can be used to retrieve information
063 * as structured value, no matter if the information was initially provided
064 * by {@link #set(String, Map)} or by several invocations of
065 * {@link #add(String, String, String)}.
066 * 
067 */
068@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
069public class ConfigurationUpdate extends Event<Void> {
070
071    public static final Pattern NUMBER = Pattern.compile("^\\d+$");
072
073    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap",
074        "PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals" })
075    private final Map<String, Map<String, String>> flatValues = new HashMap<>();
076    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
077    private final Map<String, Map<String, ?>> structuredValues
078        = new HashMap<>();
079
080    /**
081     * Each value in the map passed as argument represents properties
082     * as a map of keys and (possibly) structured values (value, 
083     * collection or map). Each such map of properties is converted
084     * to a (possibly larger) map of properties where the structural
085     * information has been added to the keys.
086     *
087     * @param structured the map with structured properties
088     * @return the map with flattened properties
089     */
090    private static Map<String, String> flatten(Map<String, ?> structured) {
091        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
092        Map<String, String> result = new HashMap<>();
093        flattenObject(result, null, structured);
094        return result;
095    }
096
097    @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals" })
098    private static void flattenObject(Map<String, String> result,
099            String prefix, Object value) {
100        if (value == null) {
101            result.put(prefix, null);
102            return;
103        }
104        if (value instanceof Map) {
105            for (var entry : ((Map<String, ?>) value).entrySet()) {
106                flattenObject(result,
107                    Optional.ofNullable(prefix).map(p -> p + ".").orElse("")
108                        + entry.getKey(),
109                    entry.getValue());
110            }
111            return;
112        }
113        if (value instanceof Collection) {
114            int count = 0;
115            for (var item : (Collection<?>) value) {
116                flattenObject(result, prefix + "." + count++, item);
117            }
118            return;
119        }
120        result.put(prefix, value.toString());
121    }
122
123    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops",
124        "PMD.ReturnEmptyCollectionRatherThanNull" })
125    private static Map<String, ?>
126            structure(Map<String, String> flatProperties) {
127        if (flatProperties == null) {
128            return null;
129        }
130        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
131        Map<Object, Object> result = new HashMap<>();
132        for (var entry : flatProperties.entrySet()) {
133            Map<Object, Object> target = result;
134            // Original key (optionally) consists of dot separated parts
135            StringTokenizer parts = new StringTokenizer(entry.getKey(), ".");
136            while (true) {
137                var part = parts.nextToken();
138                Object key = NUMBER.matcher(part).find()
139                    ? Integer.parseInt(part)
140                    : part;
141                if (!parts.hasMoreTokens()) {
142                    // Last part (of key), store value
143                    target.put(key, entry.getValue());
144                    break;
145                }
146                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
147                var newTarget = (Map<Object, Object>) target
148                    .computeIfAbsent(part, k -> new TreeMap<Object, Object>());
149                target = newTarget;
150            }
151        }
152
153        // Now convert all maps that have only Integer keys to lists
154        for (var entry : result.entrySet()) {
155            entry.setValue(maybeConvert(entry.getValue()));
156        }
157
158        // Return result
159        @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "rawtypes" })
160        Map<String, ?> res = (Map<String, ?>) (Map) result;
161        return res;
162    }
163
164    @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "PMD.ConfusingTernary" })
165    private static Object maybeConvert(Object value) {
166        if (!(value instanceof Map)) {
167            return value;
168        }
169        List<Object> converted = new ArrayList<>();
170        for (var entry : ((Map<Object, Object>) value).entrySet()) {
171            entry.setValue(maybeConvert(entry.getValue()));
172            if (converted != null && entry.getKey() instanceof Integer) {
173                converted.add(entry.getValue());
174                continue;
175            }
176            converted = null;
177        }
178        return converted != null ? converted : value;
179    }
180
181    /**
182     * Set new (updated) structured configuration values for the event.
183     * Any information associated with the path before the invocation
184     * of this method is replaced.  
185     * 
186     * @param path the value's path
187     * @return the event for easy chaining
188     */
189    public ConfigurationUpdate set(String path, Map<String, ?> values) {
190        if (path == null || !path.startsWith("/")) {
191            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Path must start with \"/\".");
192        }
193        synchronized (this) {
194            flatValues.remove(path);
195            structuredValues.put(path, values);
196        }
197        return this;
198    }
199
200    /**
201     * Return the structured properties for a given path if they exists.
202     * 
203     * @param path the path
204     * @return the updated values or `null` if the path has been
205     * removed (implies the removal of all values for that path).
206     */
207    public Optional<Map<String, ?>> structured(String path) {
208        synchronized (this) {
209            Map<String, ?> result;
210            if (!structuredValues.containsKey(path)
211                && flatValues.containsKey(path)) {
212                // Synchronize to structured and return
213                result = structure(flatValues.get(path));
214                structuredValues.put(path, result);
215            } else {
216                result = structuredValues.get(path);
217            }
218            if (result == null) {
219                return Optional.empty();
220            }
221            return Optional.of(Collections.unmodifiableMap(result));
222        }
223    }
224
225    /**
226     * Add a new (or updated) configuration value to the event.
227     * 
228     * @param path the value's path
229     * @param key the key of the value
230     * @param value the value
231     * @return the event for easy chaining
232     */
233    public ConfigurationUpdate add(String path, String key, String value) {
234        if (path == null || !path.startsWith("/")) {
235            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Path must start with \"/\".");
236        }
237        synchronized (this) {
238            if (!flatValues.containsKey(path)
239                && structuredValues.containsKey(path)) {
240                // Flattened version becomes current, invalidate structured
241                flatValues.put(path, flatten(structuredValues.get(path)));
242            }
243            structuredValues.remove(path);
244            @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
245            Map<String, String> scoped = flatValues
246                .computeIfAbsent(path, newKey -> new HashMap<String, String>());
247            scoped.put(key, value);
248        }
249        return this;
250    }
251
252    /**
253     * Signal to handlers that a path has been removed from the 
254     * configuration.
255     * 
256     * @param path the path that has been removed
257     * @return the event for easy chaining
258     */
259    public ConfigurationUpdate removePath(String path) {
260        if (path == null || !path.startsWith("/")) {
261            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Path must start with \"/\".");
262        }
263        synchronized (this) {
264            flatValues.put(path, null);
265            structuredValues.remove(path);
266        }
267        return this;
268    }
269
270    /**
271     * Return all paths affected by this event.
272     * 
273     * @return the paths
274     */
275    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ConfusingTernary")
276    public Set<String> paths() {
277        synchronized (this) {
278            Set<String> result = new HashSet<>(flatValues.keySet());
279            result.addAll(structuredValues.keySet());
280            return result;
281        }
282    }
283
284    /**
285     * Return the properties for a given path if they exists.
286     * 
287     * @param path the path
288     * @return the updated values or `null` if the path has been
289     * removed (implies the removal of all values for that path).
290     */
291    public Optional<Map<String, String>> values(String path) {
292        synchronized (this) {
293            Map<String, String> result;
294            if (!flatValues.containsKey(path)
295                && structuredValues.containsKey(path)) {
296                // Synchronize to flatValues and return
297                result = flatten(structuredValues.get(path));
298                flatValues.put(path, result);
299            } else {
300                result = flatValues.get(path);
301            }
302            if (result == null) {
303                return Optional.empty();
304            }
305            return Optional.of(Collections.unmodifiableMap(result));
306        }
307    }
308
309    /**
310     * Return the value with the given path and key if it exists.
311     * 
312     * @param path the path
313     * @param key the key
314     * @return the value
315     */
316    public Optional<String> value(String path, String key) {
317        if (!flatValues.containsKey(path)
318            && structuredValues.containsKey(path)) {
319            flatValues.put(path, flatten(structuredValues.get(path)));
320        }
321        return Optional.ofNullable(flatValues.get(path))
322            .flatMap(map -> Optional.ofNullable(map.get(key)));
323    }
324}
